name: Upscayl
description: Upscayl is a free, open-source AI image upscaler that enhances low-resolution images for Linux, MacOS, and Windows.
longDescription: Upscayl is a cross-platform, open-source application designed to upscale low-resolution images using advanced AI algorithms, primarily built with a Linux-first philosophy. Its mission is to provide an accessible, high-quality image enhancement tool that transforms blurry or pixelated photos into sharp, high-resolution visuals without requiring extensive technical expertise. The software leverages the Real-ESRGAN architecture and NCNN framework to guess and reconstruct image details, making it ideal for photographers, graphic designers, and casual users. Available as both a desktop application and a cloud-based service, Upscayl supports offline processing, ensuring user privacy and flexibility. It caters to a wide audience by offering a user-friendly interface and compatibility across multiple operating systems.
features: AI-powered upscaling enhances image resolution up to 16x while preserving quality.
Batch upscaling processes multiple images simultaneously, saving time for users.
Custom model support allows users to integrate specialized AI models for tailored upscaling.
Side-by-side comparison view displays before and after results for easy evaluation.
Double upscaling option achieves higher resolution for precision-demanding projects.
Offline processing ensures privacy and functionality without internet dependency.
Cross-platform support ensures seamless performance on Linux, MacOS, and Windows.
Multiple output formats (PNG, JPG, WebP) provide flexibility for various use cases.

faqs.question: What is Upscayl used for?
faqs.answer: Upscayl uses AI to upscale and enhance low-resolution images, making them sharper and clearer for personal or professional use.

faqs.question: Does Upscayl require a powerful GPU?
faqs.answer: Upscayl requires a Vulkan-compatible GPU for optimal performance, though some users may emulate Vulkan on less powerful systems with reduced efficiency.

faqs.question: Is Upscayl completely free to use?
faqs.answer: The desktop version of Upscayl is free and open-source, while the cloud service offers a free trial with paid plans starting at $9.99.

faqs.question: Can I use Upscayl offline?
faqs.answer: Yes, the desktop version of Upscayl supports fully offline image processing, ensuring privacy and no internet dependency.

faqs.question: What types of images work best with Upscayl?
faqs.answer: Upscayl performs best with images containing simple lines and textures, though it may struggle with highly complex images.

faqs.question: How do I install Upscayl on Linux?
faqs.answer: Download the AppImage, Flatpak, or Snap version from the official website, enable execution permissions if needed, and run the file.

faqs.question: Can I upscale multiple images at once?
faqs.answer: Yes, Upscayl supports batch upscaling, allowing users to process multiple images simultaneously for efficiency.

faqs.question: What AI models does Upscayl use?
faqs.answer: Upscayl uses Real-ESRGAN-based models by default and allows users to add custom models for specific upscaling needs.
